div.l: What wol ye don while hit is in hond
¶ Bi god bi the hoper wol I stond
Qduod Iohn ⁊and se how the corn̄ goth in
Yit say I neuer bi my fader kyn
How that the hoper waggeth to ⁊and fro
¶ Aleyne onswerede Iohn wolt thou so
Then wol I be bynethe bi my crown
And se how the mele falleth a down
In to the trough that shal be my desport
For Iohn in feith I may be of youre sort
I am as euel a myller as ben ye
¶ This myller smyled of hur nycete
And thought al this is don̄ for a wyle
Thei wene that no man may hem bigyle
But bi my thryft yit shal I blere hur͗e eye
For al the sleighte of hur philosophye
The mo queyte crekes that thei make
The more wol I stele whenne I take
In stede of flour yet wol I yeue hem bren
The grettest clerkes beth not wysest men
And thenne he goth vn to the mare
Of al hur art yeue I not a tare
¶ Out of the dore he goth ful pryuely
When he say hs tyme softely
He loketh vp ⁊and doıı̄un til he haue founde
The clerkes hors there he stod y bounde
Bi hynde the dore vnder a lesell
And to the hors he goth feyre ⁊and well
He strypeth of the bridell there a non
And when the hors was lose he bigynneth to gon
Toward the fenne ther͗e wilde mares renne
And forth goth he thrugh thicke ⁊and thynne
